Detailed Description

Defines the USB objects for each connection to the controller.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

INTERFACE::INTERFACE ( char *  serial,
bool *  success 
)

Constructor for USB for motors Initializes/opens the port according to the parameter.
For eg. object usb0 would have '/dev/ttyUSB0' as serial

Parameters:
serial specifies the port for the interface object.
success becomes true if this serial port was successfully initialized

INTERFACE::INTERFACE ( char *  serial,
bool *  success,
bool  xray 
)

Constructor for serial for XRay Tube Initializes/opens the port according to the parameter.
In this case the serial passed would always be '/dev/ttyS0'

Parameters:
serial specifies the port for the interface object.
success becomes true if this serial port was successfully initialized
xray a useless variable to differentiate between the 2 constructors

Member Function Documentation

void INTERFACE::close_serialfd (  ) 

closes the port of the object.

char * INTERFACE::getSerial (  ) 

gets the port of the object.

Returns:
the port

void INTERFACE::print (  ) 

For debugging - Prints out the parameters of an interface object: Serial & Serialfd.

char * INTERFACE::send_command ( char *  c,
int  rb 
)

Sends the command to the controller via the port of this object.

Parameters:
c the command to be sent to the contoller
rb is passed as 1 if buffer needs to be read back from controller after sending command, else 0 is passed
Returns:
buffer read from the controller.

char * INTERFACE::send_command_to_tube ( char *  c,
int  rb,
int &  value,
int &  value2 
)

Sends the command to the XRayTube via '/dev/ttyS0'

Parameters:
c the command to be sent to the tube
rb is passed as 1 if buffer needs to be read back from tube after sending command, else 0 is passed
value is a pointer which points to the integer value of the buffer
value2 is a pointer which points to the second integer value of the buffer. for cmd gn/ga
Returns:
the binary value of the buffer read from the controller.
